title: Chelsea team news: Cesc Fabregas is benched against Burnley and Twitter users are baffled after Antonio Conte compared him to Andrea Pirlo
text:
EFL 'Conte should be sacked' Chelsea team news: Cesc Fabregas is benched against Burnley and Twitter users are baffled after Antonio Conte compared him to Andrea Pirlo 
Blues manager called his Spanish midfielder a 'genius' after he scored within minutes of coming on against Arsenal By TOBY GANNON Comments CHELSEA fans have been left baffled by Antonio Conte’s decision to bench Cesc Fabregas against Burnley. 
The Spanish midfielder was hailed as a “genius” by his boss after scoring within a minute in his substitute appearance against Arsenal last weekend. Getty Images Cesc Fabregas has been left out of Chelsea’s starting XI for today’s game at Burnley 
Conte even compared him to former Juventus maestro Andrea Pirlo. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
He said: “Cesc is a top player and is a genius at football. I can talk in the same way about Andrea Pirlo. 
“Cesc if he doesn’t run 100 metres in 10 seconds, I can allow him this, because he’s a genius with the ball. His velocity is in his mind.” 
Yet the ex-Italy manager has left Fabregas, 29, out of his starting XI. 
And supporters are lost for words that the player who worked so well in their title-winning 2014-15 season is no longer a regular in the team. AP:Associated Press Cesc Fabregas scored within moments of coming on the pitch against Arsenal Fàbregas on bench again pic.twitter.com/CjnU37ReQ8 
— Abdus Samad عبدالصمد (@AkhAbdi) February 12, 2017 Conte should be sacked for playing Matic over Fabregas, he's an enemy of good football 
— Taonga Chipeta (@sarai_tee) February 12, 2017 Fabregas can’t even get a start 😢 
— Josh Craig (@josh2712) February 12, 2017 No Fabregas again 😡 
— ujjwal kumar singh (@Chelsinghcfc) February 12, 2017 Matic over Fabregas again 🤔 
— The Asian one (@etraill95) February 12, 2017 Seems strange that Conte can call Cesc Fabregas "a genius", compare him to Pirlo, then bench him again 🤔 pic.twitter.com/NPjrPiPyd2 
— Ololade Tejumola (@iamTejuLade) February 12, 2017 Related Stories Nou Ideas Chelsea target and PSG star Marco Verratti admits Barcelona move would be too good to turn down Bak to Business Chelsea and Man Utd handed huge transfer boost as Monaco star Tiemoue Bakayoko rejects new contract Ankle anguish John Terry shares, and then deletes gruesome injury vid...but is Diego Costa to blame? Thierry Henry I poked N'Golo Kante to see if he was real... Chelsea's midfielder should be crowned PFA Player of the Year PASSION VICTIM Antonio Conte admits he cannot watch himself on TV after games as he is ashamed of the passion he shows 
Fabregas has started just five Premier League games this season, making ten further appearances off the bench. 
Conte has enjoyed success with the midfield partnership of N’Golo Kante and Nemanja Matic, who have helped steer the Blues to top of the table. 
The Chelsea boss yesterday explained: “Sometimes you must make the decision and to look the balance of the team. 
“And sometimes you must make different decisions. For me Cesc is an important player. PA:Press Association 5 Nemanja Matic was picked ahead of Cesc Fabregas for the clash at Burnley 
“And I try to put him always in the best condition to give us his best for the team. 
“Don’t forget in his place is playing Kante. A lot of people spoke that he is the best player in the league. 
“Then is Matic that I think is playing in an outstanding way. 
“When you have two players in front [of you] playing so well it’s not easy. Reuters Antonio Conte compared Cesc Fabregas to Andrea Pirlo after the Arsenal match Reuters 5 Antonio Conte called Cesc Fabregas a ‘genius’ but opted to bench him on Sunday 
“It’s the same for Willian and Pedro. For me, sometimes it’s very difficult to sleep and to make the best decision. 
“But I prefer to have this type of problem. The most important thing is these players are totally involved in the team. 
“Cesc is playing with us and is very important for the team.” Sunday Premier League match preview featuring Burnley v Chelsea
